speak;Shanna;What? But I do fine on my own!
speak;Dieck;It worries us when you go charging in like that...
speak;Dieck;Can you stand up to a whole army on your own?
speak;Dieck;Then match your pace with the others and work as a team.|That'll maximize our chance of victory.
speak;Dieck;Wars aren't fought alone, you know.

name: DieckShannaSupportA
_source: speak;Shanna;Dieck!|See how I've been adjusting my pace to the others lately?
speak;Dieck;Yeah...|But don't rely on them to much.
speak;Shanna;Huh?|That's not what you said earlier!
speak;Dieck;What I said then applies to soldiers.|What I'm saying now applies to sellswords.

speak;Dieck;A sellsword has to fend for him or herself.|No one's gonna watch your back.|Always question others. You should even question me.|Question whether my orders serve the group, or if they're just putting you in harm's way to protect myself.
speak;Shanna;You would never make orders like that.
speak;Shanna;I am sure. And so are Lot and Ward.|That's why we entrust our lives to you.

name: WadeShannaSupportC
_source: speak;Wade;Don't buzz about the front lines so much.
speak;Shanna;Buzz about?! Am I an insect?!
speak;Wade;You might as well be! Archers sure make short work of you!
speak;Shanna;Oh yeah?!|Then you're an ape, you stupid, slowpoke axefighter!|You can't even dodge!
speak;Wade;Say that again!|You pickin' a fight with me?!
speak;Shanna;You started it, you idiot!|But fine, you're on! Just try and hit me all the way up here.
speak;Wade;Hey... Shanna! No fair!|Get down here!
speak;Shanna;Yeah, right! Catch me if you can!
speak;Wade;Blast it!|She really knows how to set me off!

name: WadeShannaSupportB
_source: speak;Shanna;Ow!|Hey! You hit me!|What did you do that for?
speak;Wade;There was an enemy archer taking aim from the bushes.
speak;Wade;And here you are, yawning it up. Idiot.
speak;Shanna;Idiot?|You have no right to call anyone an idiot, let alone me!
speak;Wade;I dunno, someone who decides to kick back in a battle seems pretty idiotic to me.|You're just lucky I happened to pass by.|You'd be vulture food by now if not for me.
speak;Shanna;Hmph, I can take care of a single archer no problem.|Do you want a favor or something? I don't need you watching my back.
speak;Wade;Oh, is that so! Then pardon me!|I'll just sit back and watch you from now on, then.|Good luck! Hope ya don't die!
speak;Shanna;That idiot!|I didn't even have a chance to thank him...

name: WadeShannaSupportA
_source: speak;Shanna;Oh, Wade.|What are you doing here.
speak;Wade;I told you to leave this area to me.|That means you don't go flying around on your own!|We have to follow Roy's orders...
speak;Shanna;But if we sit around waiting for orders all the time, we could miss an opportunity!
speak;Wade;Don't you get it?!|What if you flew out by yourself into a bunch of enemy archers?!|Why don't you just think before you act...?
speak;Shanna;What?|I thought you were angry about me fighting with you.
speak;Wade;Of course I am!|We need to work as a team in battle...
speak;Shanna;Then what was all that about archers and stuff?
speak;Wade;W-w-what are you talking about?! N-n-no way!|Y-you just don't know how to act in battle...
speak;Wade;...Oh, c'mon. You're not supposed to say that.

name: LotWadeSupportC
_source: speak;Wade;All right, who's next! Bring it on!
speak;Lot;Wade, can't you calm down a bit?
speak;Wade;Then what's the problem?|I rush in, and you do everything else.|That's worked great so far.
speak;Lot;Mary asked me to take care of you.
speak;Wade;My sister said that? I'm not a kid anymore...

name: LotWadeSupportB
_source: speak;Lot;Wade, you seem to be doing well today.
speak;Wade;Of course! I'm always great.|You better fight hard, too, buddy.|You need money to buy medicine for your mother...
speak;Lot;My mother, she...|She didn't make it.
speak;Lot;Because if I did, you'd tell me to go home to Mieu.
speak;Wade;No kidding! She's all alone now.|Don't you care about your baby sister?
speak;Lot;But I got the message during a job.|I couldn't leave without finishing.

name: LotWadeSupportA
_source: speak;Lot;Wade, you're acting strangely as of late.|Do you have something to say to me?
speak;Wade;Don't die.|Whatever you do, don't die.
speak;Wade;If you're killed, what will happen to Mieu?|She's just a little girl. She'll be forced to live on her own.
speak;Lot;But you're no different.|Mary would be devastated if you were killed.
speak;Wade;Oh, sure, like she would cry over me.
speak;Lot;It's not just me that can't die here.|It's both of us.|One day, we'll go back home.
speak;Wade;...It's just a dirty village with no clean water or vegetation.
speak;Lot;Maybe so, but it's our home, and we both have people waiting for us.
speak;Wade;Yeah, you're right. Let's not disappoint them!

name: WadeEchidnaSupportC
_source: speak;Echidna;Hey, you're from the Western Isles, aren't you?
speak;Echidna;I can tell by your face.
speak;Wade;Really? That's actually kind of impressive...
speak;Echidna;Are you going back to your hometown after the war?|If you are, I could use your help.
speak;Echidna;I'm planning to build a new village for people who lost their homes in the war.|I can't do it myself, though.
speak;Wade;What do you want me to do?
speak;Echidna;Oh, there are plenty of things you could do.|Chop firewood, clean the laundry, help with cooking...
speak;Wade;...I'm no servant. I live the mercenary life.|Sorry, but you better ask someone else...
speak;Echidna;You'll help us? Fantastic! I knew you would.
speak;Wade;Wait, that's not what I said! Were you even listening?!
speak;Echidna;...Sure I was. But I can tell that you want to.
speak;Echidna;I can see in your eyes your desire to help.

name: WadeEchidnaSupportB
_source: speak;Wade;You again... I'm not helping, alright?
speak;Echidna;Trust me, you don't want to be a mercenary.|You never know when you could die.|And you're weak, so that'll be sooner rather than later.
speak;Wade;Grr... You'll regret saying that...|You don't want to see me when I'm angry.
speak;Wade;What are you looking at me like that for?!|I've slain monsters stronger than any human!
speak;Echidna;Wow, now that's something.|What kind of beasts?
speak;Wade;...Near my village... there's this weird cave.|When I was a kid, people said it was filled with monsters.|So one day I got my friend Lot and we went to defeat them.

speak;Wade;The cave was dark and damp... Something seemed wrong.|Lot was scared, but I was fine.|I led the way...and finally, there they were.|The monsters were crawling all over the cave floor.|Long, skinny bodies slithering about, all scaly and spotted...
speak;Wade;......|Well, I guess they were kind of like snakes. But these were no ordinary snakes.|They were monsters, with poison and strange dances and weird moves...
speak;Echidna;Yeah... Snakes. Anyway, where is this cave?
speak;Echidna;I'll go check it out on my way to the village site.|I'm curious now.
speak;Wade;B-but I already killed all the monsters...
speak;Echidna;You said they were all over the cave floor.|Some might have escaped. They were no ordinary snakes, right?|I want to see them.

name: WadeEchidnaSupportA
_source: speak;Echidna;Well, we meet again.|Doesn't looking at my face make you want to help out?
speak;Wade;No.|...But...|When the war is over, I might just stop by my old home.|And if I get bored, maybe I'll come and help a little.
speak;Echidna;Do you have family back home?
speak;Wade;Yeah, an older sister who never stopped yelling at me.
speak;Echidna;...Sigh...|You're pretty stupid, you know that?
speak;Wade;Stupid?|What do you mean by stupid, you--
speak;Echidna;You've got a home to return to.|You've got someone waiting for you.
speak;Echidna;Help us out if you have time, but your sister is more important.|Do you understand?
speak;Wade;Yeah, yeah, I know...|Can't wait for her to scold me again...

name: LotShannaSupportC
_source: speak;Lot;Shanna, don't come out front so often.|Pegasi are easy prey for archers.
speak;Lot;And you're frail, so make sure you retreat from danger.
speak;Shanna;Lot! You're such a worrywart. I am a knight.
speak;Lot;Just remember that you can never be overly cautious in battle.|Staying wary will keep you alive.

name: LotShannaSupportB
_source: speak;Lot;Shanna, you can't always charge in like that.
speak;Lot;No buts. You should be more...
speak;Shanna;Why are you always so concerned about me?|Oh wait, I get it.|Aww, I never knew you felt that way about me!
speak;Lot;...I have a little sister back home.
speak;Shanna;A sister?|Does she look like me or something?
speak;Lot;She's a lot younger than you. She isn't even ten years old.|That's why I worry like I do, fighting in battles like this...
speak;Lot;Shanna, you have an older sister, right?
speak;Lot;Then take care of yourself. If not for your sake, then for them.|Imagine how they'd feel if something happened to you.
speak;Shanna;Yeah... You're right. I'll be more careful.

name: LotShannaSupportA
_source: speak;Lot;Shanna.|You seem to be doing well lately.
speak;Shanna;I'm being more careful now. I don't rush in anymore.
speak;Shanna;Why are you always so concerned about me?|Oh wait, I get it.|Aww, I never knew you felt that way about me!
speak;Lot;Yeah, not as much as before, anyway.
speak;Shanna;Shoot, that means I can still improve, doesn't it...?|Oh yeah, I had something I wanted to tell you, too.
speak;Lot;Something to tell me? What is it?
speak;Shanna;A tip for battle! Do you want to hear it?
speak;Shanna;Then give me your ear for a sec.
speak;Shanna;......|Don't stress yourself out so much, Brother.
speak;Shanna;That was from your cute little sister!

name: LotEchidnaSupportC
_source: speak;Echidna;Hey, you're from the Western Isles, right?
speak;Echidna;Easy. Your face.|All men from the Isles have features like yours.
speak;Echidna;Are you going back home after the war?|If you are, I could use your help.
speak;Echidna;I'm planning on building a new village in the Western Isles.|It'll be for people who lost their homes during the war.|I want you to help build it.
speak;Lot;All right, I'll do what I can...
speak;Lot;But I can't make any promises.|I can only help if I'm still alive when the war ends.
speak;Lot;I only say it because it's a distinct possibility.|I'm not one to make empty promises...
speak;Echidna;You sure worry a lot for someone your age.|You'll be getting gray hairs before thirty at that rate.

name: LotEchidnaSupportB
_source: speak;Lot;You're the one who wanted to build the village...
speak;Echidna;The planning's going along smoothly.|A free village, open to anybody...|It's like a dream coming true.
speak;Lot;Do you have the money to build it?
speak;Echidna;...You want logistics now, eh?|To tell the truth... No.|But there are mines in the Isles, so I just need to go in and find the mother lode.
speak;Lot;That seems pretty unlikely...|...Oh, wait.|I know of an old, deserted gold mine you could try.
speak;Lot;Yeah, I went there with my friend Wade when I was a kid.|There were rumors that the place was haunted, so nobody went near it.
speak;Lot;Wade was really scared. He probably believed the rumors.|We went in a ways, and Wade let out a scream and ran for the entrance.|So I followed him out.
speak;Lot;Yeah, snakes.|Tons of them.|They covered the whole cave floor.|What I want to know is how they got there in the first place...|But anyway, the mine was closed because of them.
speak;Echidna;I see... So there might still be some gold left in there.|Sounds interesting.|We might get enough money for the village there.|Say, can you take me when you get the chance?
speak;Lot;I don't mind... But it'll be dangerous.
speak;Echidna;Oh, I'm not worried.|You'll be there to protect us.

name: LotEchidnaSupportA
_source: speak;Echidna;Don't you die. I need you to survive.
speak;Lot;I don't plan on dying. I have a sister back home.|And there's also...
speak;Echidna;Oh, I get it.|You've got a special somebody waiting for you, eh?|Well, well, aren't you a lucky guy?
speak;Lot;......|I want to go home as soon as I can, provided I'm alive...
speak;Echidna;Are you worrying about that again?
speak;Lot;The enemies get stronger all the time.|I don't know how much longer I'll last.
speak;Lot;I'm confident that we'll win in the end...|But I just don't know that I'll make it home.
speak;Echidna;Someone your age should be enjoying life!|I know you have your sister to think of.|But let yourself go once in a while.|You might get a few cuts and bruises, but that's life.
speak;Lot;...I don't like cuts and bruises.
speak;Echidna;Don't worry. If you die, I'll take care of things.|So go out and get killed! It'll be fine.|...Trust me.
speak;Lot;......|Somehow I don't think that came out like she intended it to...|Was she...trying to cheer me up?

name: ShannaTheaSupportC
_source: speak;Thea;...Shanna, this is a battlefield.|What if an archer heard you screaming like that?
speak;Shanna;Don't worry. No archer can hit me.
speak;Thea;...Sigh...|...Shanna, where are your reins?|You could fall off your pegasus without them.
speak;Thea;You took them off?|Shanna, you never know what can happen.|So considering all the possibilities, I think...
speak;Shanna;You worry too much, Thea!|Flying is more fun without all the extra gear.|See ya!
speak;Thea;Shanna, wait! I'm not finished yet...|...Sigh.

name: ShannaTheaSupportB
_source: speak;Shanna;Thea... You're starting to get annoying...
speak;Thea;I worry for your sake.|If you won't listen to your big sister, I won't let you ride that pegasus anymore.
speak;Thea;Shanna, you brought this upon yourself.
speak;Shanna;You're always like that!|Always saying everything's my fault...|You could say it... a little nicer...
speak;Thea;I can't! If I did, you wouldn't--
speak;Shanna;W-what the?! What are you doing?!
speak;Thea;Juno...used to pet our heads like this, didn't she?|I'm your big sister, too...|So I thought I should try to make you feel better...
speak;Thea;Shanna, I'm sorry...|I don't know how to be kind like Juno...
speak;Shanna;Thea...|...Did you take a hit to the head or something?
speak;Thea;......|Why, you...|Fine, I don't care anymore.|You can fend for yourself from now on!
speak;Shanna;Hey, wait! Sorry!|It just slipped out...

name: ShannaTheaSupportA
_source: speak;Shanna;I'm sorry about before.|But I was really happy that you care so much.|I love you, Sister!
speak;Thea;......|...How can you say that without turning red...?|I envy you sometimes...
speak;Shanna;What about you? Do you love me, too?
speak;Thea;...There's no need to say it out loud...
speak;Thea;It's just that...|We don't have to say it here, in the middle of...
speak;Shanna;Oh... I... I never knew.|Thea... You never loved me...
speak;Thea;All right, all right! I love you!|Of course I love you. You're my only little sister.|I'll...I'll always care for you.

name: ShannaJunoSupportC
_source: speak;Juno;It's already been a year since you left for training...|Are you getting along with the other mercenaries?|I heard they were all men. Are you doing all right?
speak;Shanna;Yeah, I'm doing fine! They're all really nice.|And I'm doing really well in battle, too!|I do all the work, actually.
speak;Shanna;Yeah!|After we joined Lord Roy, the enemies started getting stronger...|But still I beat all of them single-handed!
speak;Juno;Wow... That's amazing.|You've been working hard, Shanna...

name: ShannaJunoSupportB
_source: speak;Shanna;Teach me how to ride a pegasus like you.|The way you fly is really neat. I wish I could fly like that...
speak;Juno;I'd like to, but not now. We're in a battle.|I can teach you when we have some free time...
speak;Shanna;...Oh.|Then let's practice our special move!
speak;Juno;Oh, that move mother used to tell us about...|But we need Thea to do the Triangle Attack.
speak;Shanna;We haven't seen each other for so long.|I just don't want us to be separated again...
speak;Juno;...You always used to cling to me like that when you were little.|Shanna, be a good girl and wait until the war is over.|Then we can spend as much time together as we like...

name: ShannaJunoSupportA
_source: speak;Juno;Shanna, I haven't had a chance to tell you yet, but...
speak;Juno;While you were away, we had a baby girl.
speak;Shanna;What?! You had a baby with Zelot?!|Where, where?! I want to hold her...
speak;Juno;I can't bring a baby to the battlefield, Shanna.|She's with a friend back home. You can see her when we go back.
speak;Shanna;Oh boy! Juno's baby... I bet she's super cute!|I really want to see her.
speak;Shanna;But wait a second... My sister had a baby?|That makes me...an aunt? I'm too young to be an aunt!

name: ShannaZelotSupportC
_source: speak;Shanna;Hey, Zelot...|Oh, hey, you're my brother now since you're Juno's husband...
speak;Zelot;Yes, you may call me 'Brother' if you wish.
speak;Shanna;Oh, right!|I wanted to ask you something.|How did you meet Juno?
speak;Shanna;Why not now?|Don't be mean. Come on, tell me!
speak;Zelot;It's not my intention to be mean...|You'll understand when you're older, but that's not a question you should ask another...
speak;Shanna;But I really want to know...|I think I have a right to know as your sister...

name: ShannaZelotSupportB
_source: speak;Zelot;...You won't let me go, will you?
speak;Shanna;We're family. I want to know everything...
speak;Zelot;Hm...|Very well, I suppose...|...We first met in battle in Etruria.|Juno's pegasus squad was hired by our enemy.
speak;Zelot;We decided to settle the dispute peacefully through diplomacy.|Juno was a beautiful and caring woman, so things went well.|We got to know each other, and it progressed after that.
speak;Shanna;What did you say when you proposed?
speak;Zelot;Y-you want to know that, too?
speak;Shanna;So did you propose? Or was it Juno?

name: ShannaZelotSupportA
_source: speak;Shanna;I'm glad you're a good guy.|You and Juno look perfect together.
speak;Zelot;Thank you.|I'm relieved you don't hate me.
speak;Shanna;Why would I hate you? You're strong, you're kind...|And Juno loves you.
speak;Zelot;By the way...tell me about yourself.|Are there any men you have in mind?
speak;Zelot;W-what?|After making me tell you so much, you won't do the same for me?
speak;Shanna;We're family.|Family have to keep secrets from each other!

name: ElenMeladySupportC
_source: speak;Elen;Oh, if you're going up front, please take your vulneraries...
speak;Melady;You seem to be more...concerned than usual.
speak;Melady;If you have something to say, then I will listen.
speak;Melady;Well, I can't force you...|But as we both serve Princess Guinivere, I would appreciate if you voiced any concerns.
speak;Melady;Ah, well, I suppose I can wait until you're ready.

name: ElenMeladySupportB
_source: speak;Elen;You said that I seemed concerned...
speak;Melady;Oh, that.|Are you ready to tell me what's on your mind?
speak;Elen;Yes. Uh...|It's just that... I wanted to apologize.
speak;Elen;When the princess and I left to meet with the Lycian lords, I didn't consult you at all.
speak;Elen;I wanted to apologize for that...|I know you have nothing but loyalty for Princess Guinivere, yet I...
speak;Melady;You just followed Princess Guinivere's orders, as is your duty.|You have nothing to apologize for.
speak;Melady;Elen, you always doubt your actions too much.|You won't be able to move forward if your mind is stuck in the past.

name: ElenMeladySupportA
_source: speak;Melady;Elen, you look a lot better now.
speak;Elen;Yes, I feel a weight has been lifted off my shoulders.|Thank you again for listening to me.
speak;Elen;But...our roles are reversed...|I am the cleric.|It is I who am supposed to listen to others to relieve them of their problems, and yet it is you who helped me.
speak;Melady;Elen, I told you not to doubt your actions.
speak;Melady;I'm actually grateful you didn't tell me when you left with the princess.
speak;Melady;Of course.|You kept Princess Guinivere safe even without me.
speak;Melady;Together I'm sure we can be of great help to Princess Guinivere.|Just don't worry so much about trivial matters anymore, all right?

name: ElenZeissSupportC
_source: speak;Zeiss;I thought that was you. You are with this army as well.
speak;Elen;Yes, I will always be at Princess Guinivere's side...|Did you join to help Madam Melady?
speak;Zeiss;That's part of it, of course, but the main reason is to see how the princess helps Bern.
speak;Elen;So you will be assisting us as well?
speak;Zeiss;Well, not exactly...|Actually, yeah, I guess I will be.
speak;Elen;Thank you. You will be of great assistance.

name: ElenZeissSupportB
_source: speak;Elen;I saw a man over there with a terribly menacing look on his face...
speak;Zeiss;What?! Where?!|Oh, him?|...Elen, he's in our army.
speak;Zeiss;You're still scared of men?|I remember it was years before you would speak to me normally like this.
speak;Zeiss;No, it's all right. That's just how you are.|But you don't need to address me as "Sir".
speak;Zeiss;OK, OK, don't lose your head about it...|Well, I'll see you around. Let me know if anything happens.

name: ElenZeissSupportA
_source: speak;Zeiss;They're the same as the ones you grew back in Bern, aren't they?
speak;Zeiss;Elen? What's wrong?|Wait, are these the wrong flowers?
speak;Elen;Why are you always... so kind to me...?

speak;Zeiss;Eh? Ah, er, well...|We come from the same town, and, uh... I don't know.|I feel that I can't... leave you alone, you know?|I want to stay by your side and protect you...|Do you not want me to?
speak;Elen;No, I'm very glad...|But I must stay by Princess Guinivere...
speak;Zeiss;I know.|I'm a knight of Bern, so I'll protect the princess, too.|I'll protect you both, so we can someday return to Bern!

name: ElenLughSupportC
_source: speak;Lugh;Sister!|I got the medicine and cloth you asked for from Merlinus.
speak;Elen;Thank you. Could you leave them there, please?
speak;Lugh;Here?|If you'll excuse me, I have to get going.
speak;Elen;Are you an assistant to the transporter?
speak;Elen;What?|A child like you... in battle?
speak;Lugh;I may be a kid, but I'm pretty handy with my magic!
speak;Elen;No, I don't doubt your ability...|It's just...children shouldn't be on the battlefield.
speak;Lugh;I'm only about two years younger than Lord Roy, though.
speak;Elen;Lord Roy...has no choice but to be here.|That is not the case for you.
speak;Lugh;No, I have no choice, either. I must fight.
speak;Lugh;Thanks for the concern, but I'm fine.|Actually, there's someplace I need to be right now.|See you later, Sister!

name: ElenLughSupportB
_source: speak;Lugh;Oh, you're the cleric from before!
speak;Elen;You really do fight on the battlefield...|Are you all right? You're not injured?
speak;Lugh;I'm fine.|I may be small, but I'm pretty fast.
speak;Elen;Lugh...|I'm still uneasy about allowing such a small child into battle...
speak;Lugh;Do I look so small?|But if that's how you want to play it, then isn't it just as dangerous to send a frail lady like you into battle?
speak;Lugh;Yep!|So if you're ever in danger, I'll come to your rescue.|You can count on me!
speak;Elen;All right, Lugh.|Please don't do anything rash.

name: ElenLughSupportA
_source: speak;Lugh;I-I thought I saw an enemy near you...|Huff, huff...|But I guess I was wrong. Thank goodness.
speak;Elen;You were looking out for me? Thank you.
speak;Lugh;Of course! I said I would protect you.
speak;Elen;You have such a kind heart...|I am sure the gods look favorably upon you.
speak;Lugh;...That smile makes you look like a goddess!
speak;Lugh;Actually, I was worried about you because you always looked so pensive.|Not that I can really blame you given the war and all...|But I feel so much better when you smile like that!
speak;Elen;I feel better when I see your smile too, Lugh.

name: ElenChadSupportC
_source: speak;Chad;Yeah. Sorry I yelled...|But I need to ask you something.
speak;Elen;I will help you if I can.
speak;Chad;OK, well, unless I'm wrong, one of these herbs is medicinal, right?|Vulneraries are made from one of these, aren't they?
speak;Elen;Yes, this one has medicinal properties.|I'm surprised you knew that.
speak;Chad;Poppa taught us at the orphanage I used to live in.
speak;Elen;He sounds like a good man.
speak;Chad;Yeah, he sure was! Well, I need to hurry with this herb.
speak;Chad;Yeah, a traveler was hit by a stray arrow.|It's not a large wound, but the bleeding won't stop.
speak;Elen;My healing staff will be more effective than the herb.|Can you show me to this traveler?

name: ElenChadSupportB
_source: speak;Chad;Thanks for your help before.|The traveler made a full recovery.|He wanted me to thank you.
speak;Elen;I only did what anyone would have.
speak;Chad;No way! I've never met anyone willing to use a pricy healing staff on a commoner.
speak;Chad;Only those with the St. Elimine Church treat commoners with staves.|And even then, it's only when the wound is lethal or something.
speak;Chad;Yeah, at least that's how it is in the Lycian countryside where I grew up.|But that's why we learned how to use herbs and things.|...At least until Bern invaded.
speak;Chad;Whoa! S-sorry, I didn't mean to make you feel down or anything...
speak;Elen;It's not your fault... I just can't believe...|I can't believe my...home country would start this war...

name: ElenChadSupportA
_source: speak;Elen;Wait! Don't go!|Please... Listen to me.
speak;Elen;My country started this war.|So I understand...if you resent a person of Bern like me...
speak;Elen;But why?|I see no hatred in your eyes. Only sorrow.
speak;Elen;Would you...tell me about it?|I think it may release some of the burden on your shoulders...

speak;Chad;......|...Poppa...the father of our orphanage... He was killed by Bern's soldiers...|We had a little garden where we grew food.|The soldiers... They trampled it with their horses because...|because they said it was in the way.|It was a tiny garden with nothing but roots, and yet they still...
speak;Elen;Then...Poppa was killed protecting the garden?
speak;Chad;Yeah... It may have been just a bunch of roots...but it was our food.
speak;Elen;Chad, you can cry... If you feel sad, let it out.

speak;Chad;...I was the oldest of the orphans, so I can't cry.|The little kids and my best friend Lugh...|They went into shock seeing Poppa killed before their eyes.|It was my job to take care of them.|I don't want to lose any more family... That's why I fight.
speak;Chad;My hatred for Bern fuels my strength...|The drive to avenge Poppa and protect all the orphans...|That was my purpose in life. It felt just!
speak;Chad;...I hated everyone from Bern.|I thought they only cared about themselves.|...Until I met you.
speak;Elen;Chad... I'm on your side.|Regardless of my home...I want to help you.|Do you hate me...?
speak;Elen;Then I'll stay at your side, Chad.|I can't replace Poppa...|But the least I can do is be there for you.

name: ElenSaulSupportC
_source: speak;Elen;Are you Brother Saul?|I am Elen, a cleric of the St. Elimine Church in Bern.|I am pleased to make your acquaintance.
speak;Saul;Dear gods, I thank you for your blessing.

speak;Saul;Truly, being able to meet such a beautiful lady is a blessing from the gods!|And you are a follower of the St. Elimine Church, no less!|This meeting must have been part of some divine plan.|Please, let us meet this evening so that we can discuss the love of the gods.
speak;Elen;Yes, I would love to. What time can you meet?|I am free all night...
speak;Elen;I am always serious about the gods.|Why would I refuse?
speak;Saul;...If you accept so easily, there's no...satisfaction.
speak;Saul;Oh!|Please, never you mind. But Elen, are you sure?|With a woman like you, I may lose control, and...do things.
speak;Elen;I'm not worried. You are a priest.|I'm sure you would never do such a thing.
speak;Saul;...Er... I'm sorry.|Perhaps some other day.
speak;Elen;Oh... I was looking forward to it...

name: ElenSaulSupportB
_source: speak;Elen;Good day, Brother Saul. It is good to see you well.
speak;Saul;...You are so tense, so stressed! You must relax your muscles.
speak;Saul;Absolutely. Those in service to the gods must learn to unwind once in a while.|You should enjoy the finer things in life at times, as I do.

speak;Saul;I once knew a lady like you...|Well, not "knew" so much as "was slapped by", but...|If you serve the gods, you must experience all of their creation.|You can experience things that will open your eyes...|Things that you will not believe.
speak;Saul;Life is all about the experiences we can have.|Shall we discuss meeting this evening again?|I am free at any time.
speak;Elen;That would be marvelous. I would love to hear you.
speak;Elen;I shall invite the others as well.
speak;Elen;Oh, yes. If you will preach, then let us help as many as we can.|I'll ask Lord Roy, Merlinus, and any others who are interested.|I'm sure some of them will be free tonight.

name: ElenSaulSupportA
_source: speak;Elen;Brother Saul... Why didn't you come that night?|Everyone was so looking forward to your sermon...
speak;Saul;Oh, er... My throat was unwell that day.|We can try again some other time...
speak;Elen;Yes, lets.|Brother Saul, you are so selfless.
speak;Elen;Oh, yes. You appear to be an impious womanizer.|Hardly someone I would call a priest.
speak;Elen;But I finally realized that there is a reason for that.|It is a character act.|It is to show that the St. Elimine Church accepts even the lowest of men.
speak;Elen;Acting as you do ruins your reputation and image...|Everyone thinks you're lazy and only interested in women...
speak;Elen;But the truth is that you do it for the church.|I could not sacrifice myself as you do. You have my respect, Brother Saul.
speak;Saul;Er... Thanks. I think.|Well, anyway, just remember to relax once in a while.

name: LughChadSupportC
_source: speak;Lugh;Here you go. That's your share.
speak;Chad;Wow, baked tarts!|Where'd you get these?
speak;Lugh;The man who delivers our meals gave me some extra ones.
speak;Chad;...They look so good... Can I really have them?
speak;Chad;All right! Thanks!|...They taste as good as they look.
speak;Lugh;Oh, sorry.|It's just that you always look so happy when you're eating.
speak;Lugh;Yeah. You look so peaceful. I'm almost envious.
speak;Chad;W-what the...? Don't make fun of me.|I-I'll be going now. Thanks for the food!
speak;Lugh;Ha ha, I wasn't making fun of you. It's nothing to be embarrassed of.

name: LughChadSupportB
_source: speak;Lugh;What?|Oh, a new pair of shoes? Where did you get these?
speak;Chad;I didn't steal them, all right?|The other day I came across an old lady who lost her key, so I helped her out and she gave me these shoes as thanks.
speak;Lugh;Then why don't you wear them? She gave them to you, not me.
speak;Chad;No, it's all right.|My shoes aren't as beat up as yours, and besides, they're a little small for me anyway.
speak;Lugh;But we're the same size.|If they're small for you, they must be small for me, too.
speak;Chad;J-just take them!|I'm older, so my feet are a little bigger than yours!
speak;Lugh;What? That's not how it works!
speak;Chad;Of course it is! End of story.|Just take the shoes, all right?|See you.

name: LughChadSupportA
_source: speak;Lugh;Chad!|What's wrong? Is something on your mind?
speak;Chad;Lugh...|I was just thinking that we've been in this army for a while now.|I wonder how the children are doing...
speak;Lugh;Yeah, I wonder.|I hope they're being good for the Elimine priests...
speak;Chad;I wonder if they're waiting for us to return...
speak;Lugh;...I'm sure they are. We're family.
speak;Chad;I've got to stay... I'm glad you came.
speak;Lugh;Oh?|Do you think finally think I'm strong enough?
speak;Chad;I already knew that you were strong.
speak;Chad;How can I say this...?|Your twin brother, Raigh.|I always felt I was the odd one out when we three were together.
speak;Lugh;Don't be ridiculous!|You're family to me, just as much as Raigh is!
speak;Chad;Yeah, I know! I know better now.|I was just creating a wall around myself.|But now I know that you're family.
speak;Lugh;...OK, I'll let it slide.|You're my older brother, even if you are...a little childish.

name: ChadRaighSupportC
_source: speak;Chad;Look, I wouldn't be here if I didn't need to be.
speak;Chad;Roy...|I mean Lord Roy wants to see us.
speak;Chad;P-pipe down! Don't be so loud!|That Merlinus guy'll be after us again!
speak;Raigh;You're afraid of the old geezer, aren't you?
speak;Chad;Well, sure.|He and Lord Roy are nobles.
speak;Raigh;Ha ha. Little Chad bows down to nobles now, does he?
speak;Chad;...Laugh if you like. But let me say this.|Nobility don't like to be opposed.|Lord Roy doesn't seem like he would anger too easily, but I don't know about the others.
speak;Chad;I don't want to see the people I care about get hurt.|I know you're proud of that mouth of yours, but unless you want to be killed, keep it shut.|...I'm going. You better come, too.

name: ChadRaighSupportB
_source: speak;Chad;I've got no choice. I can't use magic like you.|My only use in this army is picking locks and gathering intel...
speak;Raigh;The other day when we went to see that Roy fellow...|He said he appreciated our work because we're close to his age.|But you humbled yourself the whole time, belittling your work.
speak;Raigh;You do something no one else can.|Have some pride in it.|You look stupid when you put yourself down.
speak;Chad;...Uh, are you trying to cheer me up.
speak;Raigh;D-don't be ridiculous!|Why would I ever want to cheer you up?!
speak;Chad;Yeah, I thought so.|Good, you had me worried for a second.

name: ChadRaighSupportA
_source: speak;Chad;Don't ignore me. I need to talk to you.
speak;Chad;What are you planning to do when the war ends?
speak;Chad;I'll go see the children.|Then I'll try and get enough money to rebuild the orphanage.
speak;Raigh;Then I'll go with you.|I can help out until the kids have a home at least.
speak;Chad;I knew you had a heart deep inside.
speak;Chad;Lugh always said you were a kind boy.|I used to think he only defended you because you're brothers, but I guess not.|Your brother knows the real you.
speak;Raigh;...You're just as naive as Lugh!|Say what you will! I'm leaving!
speak;Chad;Hah, there's no need to be embarrassed...|Hey! Wait! You're actually leaving?!

name: ChadCathSupportC
_source: speak;Cath;...You don't know me? I'm Cath, Master Thief!
speak;Cath;...Stupid, ignorant... I'm a better thief than you.|You're below me. You should be begging me for tips.
speak;Chad;I don't think so.|I learned how to steal all on my own, and I'm gonna keep it that way.
speak;Cath;No, you won't get any further like that.|I guess I can take you under my wing. Show you the ropes. Since you insist.
speak;Cath;Now you're my first apprentice. You must do my bidding.
speak;Cath;I know one good reason. Isn't this your bag?
speak;Chad;H-hey! When did you...?!|Give it back!

name: ChadCathSupportB
_source: speak;Chad;Give me back my bag! Now!
speak;Cath;Easy there, fella. Here ya go.
speak;Cath;What are those sketches? Who is that?
speak;Chad;Poppa... Not my real father, but close enough.
speak;Chad;...I wasn't the brightest student, but Poppa always praised my drawings.|He said I had nimble fingers and that I could be an artist someday...
speak;Cath;......|I see...|............|Argh!|Now things are awkward. I like it positive.|You should too, Firsty.
speak;Cath;That's you.|You're my first apprentice, remember?

name: ChadCathSupportA
_source: speak;Cath;I've been watching you. You seem to be improving.|You're still nowhere near my level, though. Of course.
speak;Chad;Yeah, whatever. I'm not your apprentice.
speak;Cath;Hey, wait.|If not my apprentice, then how about my partner?
speak;Cath;Yeah. We could be partners.|The fabled pair of thieves out to save the poor!|Sounds pretty cool, huh?
speak;Cath;What? Wait a minute!|I'm Cath, Master Thief! You should be honored!|Come back here!

name: ChadHughSupportC
_source: speak;Hugh;Huh? So what if I am, kid?
speak;Chad;Is it true that you're a moneylender?
speak;Hugh;Well, you're out of luck, kid.|I only lend money to grown-ups. Especially to lovely ladies.
speak;Chad;...Oh.|All right, I'll ask someone else then.
speak;Hugh;Hey, hey, hey, slow down there.|Have a little more persistence, kid.|You can't give up so easily.
speak;Chad;But you only lend money to adults, don't you?
speak;Hugh;Well, if you insist, I can make an exception for you.|But your interest will be twice the normal rate.
speak;Chad;I thought you'd say something like that.|...But fine. Let me borrow the money.|I'll give it back when we get paid.
speak;Hugh;One, two, three. Here you go, 3,000 gold.
speak;Hugh;Remember, it's 4,000 after interest!|...How could I turn him down after he looked at me like that?|This is why I hate kids...

name: ChadHughSupportB
_source: speak;Chad;Hey! Here's the money I owe you.
speak;Hugh;One, two, three, four. Yup, that's 4,000.|I haven't seen you around lately so I thought you ran off with it.
speak;Chad;I keep my promises. What kind of person doesn't?
speak;Hugh;You'd be surprised.|You're an honest kid. You sure you chose the right career?
speak;Chad;Stop calling me "kid". My name is Chad.
speak;Hugh;All right, Chad.|So tell me, why'd you become a thief?
speak;Chad;...Stealing's the only way I could live. I'm an orphan.

speak;Chad;No, I lived in a small orphanage in Lycia near the border to Bern.|I grew up with other orphans.|We did pretty well. Poppa and the other kids and me...|...If this war hadn't broken out, I'd still be there.

speak;Chad;Poppa was a good man, but he could only keep the orphanage running through charity.|After the war started we began to run low on food and clothes.|I was the oldest of the orphans, but I couldn't find any work.|So the only way to get food was to steal.
speak;Hugh;Then I'm guessing you sent that 3,000 gold to the orphanage...
speak;Chad;Poppa was killed by Bern's troops and the place was burned down...
speak;Hugh;W-what about the children? Were they spared?
speak;Chad;Thanks to Poppa, yeah. None of us were hurt.|The children are with the St. Elimine Church now.
speak;Chad;I used the money to buy a strong sword.|I'm going to use it to end this war quickly.|Then I can go back to the children!
speak;Hugh;So the kids are family to you. You want to protect them.
speak;Chad;That's right. I've got nothing else.|You got a problem with that?
speak;Hugh;Not at all...|I'm sorry I was so rude with you before.|You've already grown up, Chad.|You're certainly more of an adult than I am.

name: ChadHughSupportA
_source: speak;Hugh;Hey! Chad! Have you been doing well?
speak;Chad;Yeah, I guess. But not as well as you.
speak;Hugh;Man, are you always such a downer?|Can't you be more like,|"Hey, Hugh! What's up?" And smile for a change.
speak;Chad;...I think I'd vomit if I tried to do that.
speak;Hugh;Aw, come on!|Your story really made me think. I want to help you!
speak;Chad;...Are you really a mage, old man?|You seem more like some kind of jester or something.
speak;Hugh;O-old man!?|Does this handsome face look like it belongs to an "old man"?!
speak;Chad;Yeah. Well, compared to mine, anyway.

speak;Hugh;Ugh! Daggers through my heart!|...I take personal offense to "old man".|Seriously, you can call me anything.|Smelly, messy, stupid, anything. Just don't call me "old man"!|I feel like my soul has died a little after hearing that!
speak;Chad;...Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!|Ha ha...huff... My...my stomach...! Ha ha ha...!
speak;Chad;Oh man, that reaction was priceless.|I really pressed your buttons with that, didn't I?|Fine, I'll call you Hugh. You're OK with that, aren't you?|Since you claim you're not an old man.
speak;Hugh;So you are capable of laughing after all!
speak;Hugh;You've always got that glare in your eyes.|Your brow is always furrowed like you're mad.|And you're rude, you have an attitude, and you never smile.
speak;Chad;Sorry, what are you talking about?

speak;Hugh;I've seen so many kids lose the ability to laugh thanks to this war.|Grown-ups have a lot of issues, but come on, kids have to laugh.|Even if the idiots who start these wars don't think so.
speak;Hugh;If there are still kids who can laugh, then maybe there is hope after all.|I know you've had it rough, but you have to laugh once in a while, OK?
speak;Chad;H-hey! Don't mess up my hair!
speak;Hugh;Ha ha ha ha, sorry! I'll see you later.|Just don't screw up!
speak;Chad;...Maybe adults aren't all as awful as I thought...

name: LughRaighSupportC
_source: speak;Lugh;Raigh! Raigh!|Can you hear me, Raigh?
speak;Raigh;...Yes, I can hear you. You don't have to shout like that.|...What do you want?
speak;Lugh;Baked tarts.|The man who delivers our meals gave me some extra ones.|They look good, don't they?
speak;Raigh;...Sweets... They're hard to find nowadays.|Savor them and eat them for yourself.
speak;Lugh;It's no fun if I eat them alone.|Let's eat them together a little later.|Anyway, I have to go now.
speak;Lugh;Oh, one more thing.|You should at least respond when you're spoken to!|I don't mind that much, but strangers might get ideas.|They might think that you're antisocial or something.
speak;Raigh;Well, they'd be right.|...But whatever.|My dear brother is as naive as ever.

name: LughRaighSupportB
_source: speak;Lugh;I was a little worried that you'd left again.|The first time was so sudden.|You just left a note and disappeared.|I thought you might have walked off again without a word...
speak;Lugh;Your note said you wanted to train your dark magic skills alone.|Was I...in your way? You didn't want me around...?
speak;Raigh;N-no, that's not it...|I always planned to come back once I became a powerful shaman.
speak;Lugh;I knew it, Raigh!|I knew you'd come back for the children!
speak;Lugh;I'm so relieved! You haven't changed at all.|You're still the kind-hearted Raigh I know and love.|I'll go pray!|I'm going to thank the gods for letting me see you again!
speak;Raigh;Uh... Bye, I guess?|...Sigh... Why is he like that?

name: LughRaighSupportA
_source: speak;Raigh;Lugh, I need to tell you something.
speak;Raigh;I...I'm sorry I left the orphanage without saying anything.|I...uh...I want to apologize for that...
speak;Raigh;A-and one more thing!|I'll never disappear without telling you again!
speak;Raigh;So will you stop hovering around me all the time?|Come on. Please!!
speak;Lugh;...Do you dislike being near me?
speak;Lugh;Then what's the problem?|Who knows if we'll still be together when we grow up?
speak;Lugh;If...|If I don't make it through this war, promise me you'll pick up the children at the St. Elimine Church.
speak;Raigh;Don't say that. We'll both survive.
speak;Lugh;Yeah... You're right.|Something's wrong with me today.
speak;Raigh;I won't let you die.|You're my brother. My only brother.

name: LughHughSupportC
_source: speak;Hugh;Oh... H-hey. You're Lugh, right?|I, uh, I'm sorry I mistook you for your brother the other day...
speak;Lugh;No, Hugh, it's all right.|We're twins, so no one can really tell us apart anyway.
speak;Hugh;Oh man, I'm really sorry, though.|I can't believe I just lost it and grabbed you by the collar like that.|I'm a terrible person.
speak;Lugh;...But it was Raigh's fault for running off with your spell tome.|I should be apologizing to you.
speak;Hugh;No, never mind that.|It was my fault for letting my guard down anyway.
speak;Lugh;But...|......|Yeah, you're right, never mind.|That whole business let us meet each other, so it's not that bad.
speak;Hugh;Yeah! We're both mages, so let's help each other along!
speak;Lugh;Yeah, actually, I was hoping that you would teach me some things.

name: LughHughSupportB
_source: speak;Lugh;Your elbow's bleeding!|We have to wrap it...
speak;Hugh;Oh, I got hit in that last fight.|Don't worry about it. It's no big deal.
speak;Lugh;Yes it is!|You can't leave a wound like that alone...
speak;Hugh;Lugh? You look a little pale...
speak;Lugh;...I've lost enough people I care about already.|...I'll treat your wound.

name: LughHughSupportA
_source: speak;Lugh;I'm sorry!|You said you were all right, but I just ignored you and...|I'm sure you don't like it when kids act like they know more than you...
speak;Hugh;Don't be ridiculous. Don't apologize for helping me.
speak;Lugh;But you seemed to be avoiding me, so I thought you were mad...

speak;Hugh;Because...|No one ever cared for me that much my whole life...|My grandmother raised me, but she's a real kook.|She's given me injuries way worse than this one, but she never once used her staves to heal me!|I was just happy to have someone concerned about me for a change...|Thanks, man.|You're my new best friend.
speak;Lugh;Of course, Hugh! Let's be friends forever!!

name: LughMeladySupportC
_source: speak;Melady;Whew... Sorry to work you so hard, Tryffin... Good girl.
speak;Lugh;Wow!|A wyvern!|Wow, it's so big!|Is this wyvern yours?|Will it get angry if I touch it?
speak;Melady;No, go ahead. She's a gentle one.
speak;Lugh;Wow, such hard scales... Her fangs are so sharp too!|Amazing... Are you a wyvern rider?
speak;Lugh;Really?!|I thought only Bern had wyvern riders!

speak;Lugh;They say Bern's wyvern riders are unbeatable, so I was a little nervous...|But they're nothing if we have wyvern riders on our side, too!|I want to defeat Bern, but I'm not very good with my magic yet, so I can't do all that much on my own...
speak;Lugh;Oh... I better get going. See you later!|Thanks for letting me pet your wyvern.

name: LughMeladySupportB
_source: speak;Lugh;Hello!|Can I give this to your wyvern?
speak;Lugh;I got some extra baked tarts, so I wanted to give some to the wyvern.|Oh wait, do wyverns even eat food like this?
speak;Melady;You love them, don't you, Tryffin? Thank you.
speak;Lugh;She's called Tryffin? Can I call her that, too?
speak;Lugh;Here you go, Tryffin. Eat up.|Good, aren't they?
speak;Lugh;Me?|I'm Lugh from Lycia. What's your name?|Where are you from?
speak;Melady;I'm Melady... I come from Bern.
speak;Melady;...I'm sorry. I couldn't get myself to say it sooner...
speak;Melady;Wait! Lugh!|...I know it was inevitable, but still...|I'm sorry, Tryffin. Just when you had made a little friend...

name: LughMeladySupportA
_source: speak;Lugh;...I'm sorry I ran off like that before.
speak;Melady;No, it's all right.|I'm glad you're speaking to me again.
speak;Lugh;I didn't want things to end like that.|...Will you listen to my story?

speak;Lugh;My parents died when I was four, and ever since then I'd been living at an orphanage in Lycia.|It was tiny, with only seven kids and one priest who we all called Poppa.|The oldest kids were Chad and my twin brother Raigh and I, so we three took care of the younger children.|We were poor, but we were happy anyway.|But after Bern started this war, our lives began to change.|Food started getting scarce, and we sometimes had to resort to begging...|Chad... He started stealing food without telling Poppa...|Raigh got fed up with that lifestyle and left one day without a word.|I hated Bern... We all did.|Bern was responsible for everything... Bern killed Poppa...|I just wanted Bern to disappear.

speak;Lugh;That's what I kept telling myself.|...Anger motivates better than sorrow...|Anger has kept me alive...|So that I can protect the children...|...Sigh...|So...for now, at least until the war ends...|I have to stay angry at Bern.|...But you're on our side, right? I don't have to hate you...|Do I?
speak;Melady;It would make me so happy if you didn't hate me, Lugh.|If you would let me, I'd even like to be...your friend.
speak;Melady;...I'm sorry. I couldn't get myself to say it sooner...

name: ClarineKleinSupportC
_source: speak;Clarine;You look absolutely stunning in that outfit!
speak;Klein;...That's all?|And here I was wondering what kind of danger you were in...
speak;Clarine;My dear brother Klein!|Everyone is so aesthetically handicapped in this army!|You are a lone diamond shining in the rough!
speak;Klein;You only think so because we're family...
speak;Clarine;I do not!|There are none in this world who can match your beauty.|Knight General Perceval may have more authority, but you clearly have superior sense in beauty!
speak;Klein;...Clarine, a lady shouldn't verbalize such things.
speak;Clarine;I only say what is true.
speak;Clarine;But if that's what you think brother, I will try.

name: ClarineKleinSupportB
_source: speak;Clarine;Oh, Klein? How do you fare today?
speak;Klein;Is it true that you spoke harshly to a cleric and made her cry yesterday?
speak;Clarine;Absolutely not. I did not make her cry. She is the one who chose to cry.
speak;Klein;...But she cried because of what you said to her.
speak;Clarine;It was her fault! She was trying to keep you for herself.
speak;Clarine;...She healed your wounds before I got the chance.
speak;Clarine;I wanted to heal your injuries so you would be proud of me!|All I want is to be of some help to you, Brother...
speak;Klein;...I was proud of you.|I was so glad that my naive little sister had grown up so much...|But now that you've done this, I don't know what to think anymore...
speak;Clarine;I-I'll never do it again!|Please don't hate me, Klein!
speak;Klein;Don't be ridiculous. I could never hate you.

name: ClarineKleinSupportA
_source: speak;Klein;What's wrong, Clarine? You look sad.
speak;Clarine;I...I don't want to go back to the manse after the war...
speak;Klein;Why not?|Mother and Father anxiously await our return.

speak;Clarine;I do want to see Mother and Father...|But if I return to the manse, I will be nothing but a doll once more.|Never again to see the outside world, concerned only with decorating myself...
speak;Klein;Well, that is how most Etrurian ladies are.
speak;Clarine;Yes, I know...|But being the most elegant in Etruria does not seem as appealing as it once did.
speak;Klein;That's because you're growing and maturing, Clarine.|If you stay at the manse, you could live your life without any worries.
speak;Clarine;But it would be so horribly boring!
speak;Klein;Yes, indeed... All right, here's what we will do.|Once this war is over, we will first let Mother and Father know we are safe.
speak;Klein;From there we can discuss your future and what you want to do.
speak;Clarine;Oh, I already know what I want to do!
speak;Clarine;I will become Mage General like General Cecilia!
speak;Clarine;Of course!|As Mage General, I will give you, the new Archer General, my full support.|Then we shall be together always!
speak;Clarine;Oh, how wonderful it would be for us both to wear that elegant general uniform...

name: ClarineRutgerSupportC
_source: speak;Clarine;Oh! We certainly do meet a lot.
speak;Clarine;You will address me as Lady Clarine.
speak;Clarine;I want to tell you something.
speak;Clarine;You actually do have quite an attractive face.|Of course, it is no comparison to my beloved brother Klein's, but for a commoner, you aren't entirely hideous.
speak;Clarine;I can use my Etrurian aesthetic sense to make you into a truly handsome noble...
speak;Clarine;Oh! Wait! Where did he go?|I was not finished speaking to him!|I should have known he was nothing but a tramp!

name: ClarineRutgerSupportB
_source: speak;Clarine;There you are! I won't let you go this time!
speak;Clarine;What!|That is no way to respond to a lady's kindness!
speak;Clarine;That is no way to talk to a lady...|That...is not how a proper gentleman...should act...
speak;Rutger;...All right, I'm sorry. Stop crying.
speak;Clarine;...I know he is not to blame... So why am I acting this way...?

name: ClarineRutgerSupportA
_source: speak;Clarine;What? Oh, my ribbon...|Thank you for returning it to me.
speak;Clarine;Um...|I just realized... I don't know your name...|Might I trouble you to tell it to me?
speak;Clarine;Rutger...|I never even thanked you for saving me...|It is no wonder you don't like me...
speak;Clarine;I thank you for rescuing me in my time of need...|I know it is far overdue, but I hope you will accept my thanks...
speak;Rutger;Don't try to be someone you're not.|You're good at screaming, so stick with that.
speak;Clarine;Wh-what do you mean by that?!
speak;Rutger;That's it... That's you.|Give me your company once in a while, Clarine. Make me smile.

name: ClarineDorothySupportC
_source: speak;Clarine;Why do you dress yourself in men's clothing?
speak;Clarine;Of course! A lady must wear elegant dresses.|And a lady must be dressed properly even when she fights.
speak;Dorothy;Really...? I suppose you're right.|I know nothing about that kind of stuff...
speak;Clarine;Hm... So I see.|Well, I suppose I can teach you all that I know.
speak;Dorothy;What? N-no!|Being ladylike doesn't suit me...
speak;Clarine;Don't be absurd! All ladies must be ladylike.|No gentleman will even give you the time of day if you look like that.
speak;Dorothy;D-do you think so...?|Well...if you're serious... then all right!|Please teach me, Lady Clarine!

name: ClarineDorothySupportB
_source: speak;Clarine;So... Dorothy, what is your schedule like?
speak;Dorothy;I'm pretty busy even off the battlefield.|I help cook meals and stuff...
speak;Clarine;What?!|Leave such dirty jobs to that plebeian Merlinus fellow!
speak;Clarine;How do you take care of your hair?
speak;Clarine;What?! I don't believe this...!|Here, use this shampoo.|Wash your hair with it three times a day!
speak;Dorothy;Th-three times?|But...it looks so expensive...|I appreciate it, but I think it would be wasted on me.
speak;Clarine;None of that now! I am offering it to you.|Please, take it.
speak;Dorothy;Oh... Well, thank you, I guess.
speak;Clarine;Additionally...you must change your speech patterns.|Try to speak more like me, with a refined, elegant tone.
speak;Dorothy;Um... OK...|My, such a beautifious day!|Let us partake of the tea and of the crumpets.|Like that?

speak;Clarine;...This will take much work...|First things first. You must learn how to take care of your hair, and how to choose your dresses, and how to dance properly, and how to turn down offers from men...
speak;Clarine;That is just to start. You mustn't give up!|The path to becoming a refined lady is a difficult one indeed!

name: ClarineDorothySupportA
_source: speak;Dorothy;I've been trying really hard to be a lady, but...|Nothing seems to have changed.|No one seems to even notice. Maybe I should just give up...
speak;Dorothy;I'm sorry! I know you were just trying to help me...|But it's not your fault!|There wasn't much to work with anyway...
speak;Clarine;Dorothy!|That is exactly what's wrong with you!

speak;Clarine;Listen to me.|A fine lady must have confidence in herself.|No matter how you dress, without faith in yourself, it is completely and utterly without meaning.|Do not devalue yourself so. Do you understand?
speak;Clarine;Have confidence in yourself!|With me as your teacher, you will be the finest of ladies!
speak;Clarine;...One additional matter...|We are friends now, are we not?
speak;Clarine;Don't call me "Lady" Clarine.|Simply "Clarine" will do.
speak;Clarine;...Ahem! Today we shall cover how to properly drink tea!
speak;Dorothy;All right! Tell me everything you know!

name: RutgerDayanSupportC
_source: speak;Dayan;You are a warrior of Sacae. What is your name?
speak;Dayan;Bulgar...|You survived.|I heard that most of the people there were killed...
speak;Rutger;......|That day...|I learned that it is the strong who consume the weak in nature.|That is true anywhere, be it Sacae...or Bern!
speak;Dayan;Then...is that the reason you are here?|To become strong and take your revenge on Bern...?

name: RutgerDayanSupportB
_source: speak;Dayan;What will you do once you have vengeance?
speak;Dayan;I ask you once more...|What do you plan to do after avenging your clan?
speak;Dayan;Will you...dedicate your life to revenge?|Will you be happy with that?
speak;Rutger;......|You want me to keep quiet, even after seeing my entire clan killed?|...You suffered the same as I have. You must understand.
speak;Dayan;That is not what I am saying. We are men of Sacae.|Those who desecrate our land must pay.|However...even if we do win this war and destroy Bern, the deceased will never return.
speak;Dayan;Revenge will not bring back that which you've lost.
speak;Rutger;......|I know no other way to live.

name: RutgerDayanSupportA
_source: speak;Dayan;Rutger.|What will you do when the war is over? Do you have a place to go?
speak;Dayan;As I thought.|Would you join the Kutolah?
speak;Dayan;Our clan lost its battle, but its soul lives on.|Once the war ends, we will gather in the plains once more.|I think you could be a great help to us.
speak;Dayan;It is not charity.|I ask you because I have faith in your strength as a warrior.
speak;Dayan;Hm... A difficult person, I see.|Then I shall say no more.|But remember that if you ever change your mind, we will welcome you with open arms.|Whatever happens to you...don't forget that.

name: RutgerKarelSupportC
_source: speak;Karel;You noticed me at this distance? Very impressive.
speak;Karel;You know of me? I am honoured.
speak;Rutger;...Everyone who wields the sword knows your name.
speak;Karel;Yes, well, I travelled alot in my youth.
speak;Rutger;...Why are you in this army?
speak;Karel;My family is here, so I joined as well.|I only hope I'm not too rusty.
speak;Karel;No, it is no jest.|I'm sure I can't hold a candle to you younger ones.

name: RutgerKarelSupportB
_source: speak;Karel;I am looking for a sparring partner.|Would you care to practice with me?
speak;Karel;Why not?|Am I unworthy of sparring with you?
speak;Rutger;Your sword is not soaked red... I pursue a different path.
speak;Karel;Perhaps you think so now, but we both follow the way of the sword...|All paths of the sword lead to the same destination.

name: RutgerKarelSupportA
_source: speak;Rutger;I want to ask you something.

speak;Rutger;I sense no hatred from your sword...|You seem to blend with the air when you attack.|Even the heaviest, strongest blades can't be one with the air...|Your sword bests them all. I want to be stronger.|If all paths of the sword lead to one place,|will I someday be able to blend with the air as you do?
speak;Karel;I was born in Sacae as well.|I grew up under the eye of our Father the Sky and our Mother the Earth.|They are the only ones within my blade.
speak;Rutger;I'm not pure Sacaen...|I can't sense them like you do...
speak;Karel;Could you hear them when you were young?
speak;Karel;You were able to hear the Sky and the Earth once.|Your hate deafens your ears.
speak;Rutger;...Do you think I will be able to hear them when this war ends?
speak;Karel;Of course you will.|The breeze that blows through the plains...|It never forgets those it loves.

name: RutgerFirSupportC
_source: speak;Fir;Uh, excuse me, are you Rutger?
speak;Fir;I was wondering if you would spar with me, if we get the chance.
speak;Fir;I've been training my skills and I've won at many arenas around Elibe.|So you don't have to go easy on me!
speak;Fir;Why not? Is it because I'm a woman?
speak;Rutger;...I swing my sword to kill.|I have no interest in using the blade for play.
speak;Fir;W-wait...!|...He thinks of sparring as "play"?|I was hoping to learn from him.|His blade is sharp and he has no hesitation in his eyes...

name: RutgerFirSupportB
_source: speak;Fir;No. I will not move until you understand that I am serious.|Draw your sword!|I train myself seriously.|I will not tolerate you calling my training mere "play".|I want to become stronger, so I want to learn from you.
speak;Rutger;...I told you that I use my sword to kill.
speak;Rutger;If I draw my blade here, you will die. Is that your wish?
speak;Rutger;You don't intend to kill me, do you?
speak;Rutger;That's why your training is play.
speak;Fir;...I just...|...Maybe I was being rude.|I should apologize the next time I see him.

name: RutgerFirSupportA
_source: speak;Fir;Rutger.|Wait, please don't glare at me like that...|I'm not here to fight.
speak;Fir;But your skills are impressive. I want to reach your level.|All I want is to be as strong as you...
speak;Rutger;My blade is soaked in blood.|Our paths differ too greatly for you to learn from me.

speak;Fir;......|A great man once told me,|"All paths of the sword lead to the same destination."|I don't know if that's true,|but I can tell you've gone down one of those paths.|I still have much to learn, so I...

name: EtruriaEndEvents
_source: # This scene was an exercise in trying to write good, faithful dialogue
# that slightly expands Roy/Cecilia's characters and their rapport
# Also I wanted to give Roy a good weapon and this evolved from that.
speak;Roy;General Cecilia, were you looking for me?|Sorry, I needed some time to take everything in...
speak;Cecilia;It's alright, this must all be very overwhelming for you.|To think, I taught the next leader of Etruria's armies.
speak;Roy;...I just never thought I would be in this position...|It feels like a lifetime ago that I was still studying in Ostia...

speak;Roy;In such a short time we've travelled so far, fought battles all throughout Elibe...|When my father called on me I could hardly believe I would be leading his knights in battle.{w} And now I'm appointed leader of Lycia and Etruria's combined armies.|It's just...
speak;Cecilia;It's all well deserved you know.{w} None of us would be standing here if it weren't for you.|Bern would already have won and conquered the continent if you hadn't led the way.

speak;Roy;No, someone else would have done it...|It's ridiculous to think I'm the only one capable enough,{w} it's only due to luck and all my allies that I'm still alive.|Others would've been just as able if not more--
speak;Cecilia;If someone else could have done it, it would have happened.

speak;Cecilia;Lord Hector was one of the greatest military minds in Elibe and he was crushed.|I led my own forces in battle and didn't stand a chance against Bern.|How many years of experience do you think there lies between you and me?{w} And look what good that did me against Zephiel.
#Not sure how I feel about these next 2 textboxes

speak;Roy;Yes, but...|I'm sorry, I just can't help but feel undeserving.|When studying it felt as if I had to try twice as hard as everyone else just to keep up{w}, I'm not that talented General Cecilia, I shouldn't be given such special treatment..

speak;Cecilia;Roy...{w} You are one of my greatest students.|Even back in Ostia I could see your tactical brilliance during your lessons.{w} You have made all of the right moves to make it this far and turn the tide in this war.|That all wasn't luck, it was skill.{w} An army is only as strong as it's leader and you are a strong leader.
speak;Roy;...Do you really mean all of that?
speak;Cecilia;Of course I do.|You should be proud, as I am, as your father is, as I'm sure Lord Hector would be as well.
speak;Roy;...Thank you, General Cecilia. That means the world to me, truly.
speak;Cecilia;Well don't let it get to your head. The real fight is just beginning.
speak;Cecilia;By the way, I have a gift for you.

speak;Cecilia;Yes, it's a type of sword made and gifted to all newly promoted generals in Etruria.{w}{clear}The king thought it appropriate to give you one, since you will be leading our armies in the coming battles.
speak;Roy;...{c:wait;700}I've never seen it's equal...|Thank you so much.
speak;Cecilia;This gift is our thanks to you, Roy.|It represents our faith that you will lead us all to victory.{w} Don't let us down.

name: SaulDorothySupportC
_source: speak;Dorothy;Where were you, Brother Saul?|You always wander off without saying anything...
speak;Saul;It is not "wandering off", Dorothy.|I was diligently spreading word of our church at the villages on the way here.
speak;Dorothy;...Somehow I don't think you were doing your job.
speak;Saul;Don't be ridiculous.|I found a young maiden being harassed by a very rude man.
speak;Saul;Please, Dorothy, have some faith in me.|Anyway, I drove the man off and rescued the maiden.|I acted exactly as a holy man ought to.
speak;Dorothy;Really? You're not exactly very strong.|How did you do it?
speak;Saul;I went to the man and clung to him, crying,|"I thought we loved each other! Why do you reject me?!"
speak;Saul;The man fled with great haste.|The maiden, however, was also gone by the time I looked back.

name: SaulDorothySupportB
_source: speak;Dorothy;Brother Saul! I can't believe you!
speak;Saul;What is it, Dorothy?|Can't I have a single moment of peace and quiet?
speak;Dorothy;Oh no, you're not brushing me away this time.|I heard what you've been up to.|You've been flirting with every girl in this army.
speak;Saul;There is a misunderstanding.|I was just trying to spread the love of the gods...
speak;Dorothy;No, I'm not accepting that again!
speak;Dorothy;I've heard that excuse before. Think of something better!
speak;Saul;Hm...|Very well. Wait a moment while I think of a new one.
speak;Saul;...Dorothy, why are you so upset?|This is nothing new.
speak;Dorothy;That's exactly the problem!|People will misjudge the church if they see you.
speak;Saul;I am insulted! I do my job properly, Dorothy.|Or haven't you noticed the sharp increase in our female followers?
speak;Dorothy;Don't you understand? If you're just flirting with everyone...
speak;Dorothy;Enough of this!|I'll chew you out tonight when we go back to the chapel.

name: SaulDorothySupportA
_source: speak;Dorothy;What is it?|I still haven't heard a valid explanation.
speak;Saul;Dorothy, I am sorry...|I am sorry I...never understood your feelings...
speak;Saul;I understand perfectly now.|You dislike my flirting because I've always left you out of it.
speak;Saul;Dorothy, I never knew that you had such strong feelings for me...
speak;Dorothy;Ah, er, um... Th-that was just...
speak;Saul;But I am a servant of the gods...|I must be equally caring to all women. Please forgive me, Dorothy...
speak;Saul;I pondered deeply, and that was the best excuse I could come up with.
speak;Saul;V-violence is not a solution, Dorothy.|Our loving gods would not approve of you pointing your bow at an ally...
speak;Dorothy;I don't care!|Get out of my sight before I fill you with arrows!
speak;Saul;Sigh...|What are you so upset about now?

name: SaulYoderSupportC
_source: speak;Saul;Father Yoder...|Do you need something from me?
speak;Yoder;No...but I thought we might talk a bit.|Are you performing your duties as you should?
speak;Saul;Of course, Father Yoder.|We get more followers every day thanks to my work.|Please take a look at this list...
speak;Yoder;...Hm.|There seem to be an overwhelmingly large number of female names on this list.
speak;Saul;Err...|Women must understand my sermons better than gentlemen do.
speak;Yoder;Just remember, Saul, that your duty is that of a missionary.|Not a philanderer.
speak;Saul;......|I can't beat him, can I...?

name: SaulYoderSupportB
_source: speak;Yoder;Saul, how is your mission coming along?
speak;Saul;Ah, yes. As I notified you in my letter,|Lord Roy is in possession of the Fire Emblem now.
speak;Yoder;Has there been anything else worth noting?
speak;Yoder;I see...|I am sorry to put you through all this, Saul.
speak;Saul;No, please don't be.|I did it all for our loving St. Elimine.
speak;Yoder;Yes, of course. That warms my heart to hear.|...Oh, Saul. I have received a complaint from Sir Merlinus.|Apparently you stalk Princess Guinivere wherever she goes...
speak;Saul;Yes, Father Yoder. That is my mission.
speak;Yoder;Saul, your mission is to keep an eye on the Fire Emblem.|And you already told me that it is now in the hands of Lord Roy.|Not Princess Guinivere.
speak;Saul;Yes, well, be that as it may, consider this, Father Yoder.|I can't follow Lord Roy wherever he goes just because he has the Emblem.|His appearance ill suits my tastes. I cannot justify it.

name: SaulYoderSupportA
_source: speak;Yoder;Saul, perhaps it is time to relieve you of your mission.
speak;Saul;What do you mean, Father Yoder?
speak;Yoder;I believe I know Lord Roy well enough to trust him.|The Fire Emblem is safe in his hands.|What we feared will surely not come to pass.|Do you agree?
speak;Saul;You are probably right.|...However, I wish to continue my mission a little longer.

speak;Saul;Of course, I understand your reasoning, Father Yoder.|Lord Roy is certainly a trustworthy person.|Still...Lord Roy is young, and needs people to guide him through this vile world.|Who better than one such as I, with so much experience in such ugliness?
speak;Saul;Er... All that said, I too am pure, so disregard my declaration if you wish.
speak;Yoder;Yes, I think I will.|...Oh, Saul.|I found this pamphlet the other day...

speak;Yoder;"All wounds treated freely for members of the church. Sign up today!"|This...treating the gods like some sort of commercial service.|I do not approve of this at all... What will others think?
speak;Yoder;...Saul, I believe you may benefit from hearing a sermon of mine.
speak;Saul;Oh, Father Yoder, I'm not worthy to have the privilege of your...
speak;Yoder;...Will you listen to my sermon?

name: SaulCeciliaSupportC
_source: speak;Saul;Oh, dear gods above... To meet such a lovely woman...|To be witness to this perfect work of beauty...
speak;Cecilia;I'm sorry, I was thinking, so I didn't hear what you said.|Would you please repeat it for me?
speak;Saul;...Erm...|Sorry, I can't.|Anyway, General Cecilia, seeing that we are both servants of the gods, might you be interested in having dinner with me some time?
speak;Cecilia;Oh, I'm sorry.|I don't serve the gods like you do.
speak;Saul;Of course you do, milady. Everyone in the world serves the gods.
speak;Saul;Yes, absolutely. So should I make arrangements for dinner?
speak;Cecilia;I suppose I'll think about it.

name: SaulCeciliaSupportB
_source: speak;Saul;To have the privilege of meeting you again...|Your beauty is so overwhelming. It is an honor.
speak;Saul;Yes, more or less.|But my only goal is to make you feel at ease around me...|Ah, yes!|We must decide on a date for our dinner meeting.|Have you thought about it?
speak;Saul;Th-this cannot be! You've forgotten?|We agreed that we all serve the gods in our own way, remember?
speak;Cecilia;Ah, yes... I think I can recall vaguely...
speak;Cecilia;I'm sorry. I'm busy with the battle.
speak;Saul;Oh... I see.|Then I suppose it shall have to be another day.|But please do not forget this time.

name: SaulCeciliaSupportA
_source: speak;Saul;I trust that you have thought about our dinner meeting?
speak;Cecilia;Oh, yes.|I will invite you to my manor when the war ends.
speak;Saul;I will look forward to that!|It is not every day that one is invited to the manor of an Etrurian noble.
speak;Cecilia;But you might want to bear in mind that my father can be...|a little difficult.

speak;Cecilia;Well, ordinarily my father is a very kind and caring man.|However, one time, when I was still a child, I invited a male friend of mine to the manor.|When my father saw him, he drew his sword and threatened his life.
speak;Saul;Uh...|I would call that more than "difficult".

speak;Cecilia;My father lost his temper, and we tried to calm him down.|But he would have none of it.|The tea spilled everywhere, the table was sliced in two, and what was supposed to be a dinner party was more like an arena battle.|My friend somehow escaped with his life.|I will never forget that day.
speak;Cecilia;But my father isn't that bad compared to my grandfather...
speak;Saul;Oh, I just remembered!|I have some work at the church that I must attend to.|I'm terribly sorry, but I don't believe I will ever be able to meet for dinner after all...
speak;Cecilia;Oh? I was looking forward to it.

name: SaulIgreneSupportC
_source: speak;Saul;That I can meet such abeautiful woman...|I feel blessed this day.
speak;Saul;Yes, as a matter of fact! ...Ah, before that...|I am Saul. And you are, my perfect flower?
speak;Igrene;I am Igrene. So...what do you need?
speak;Saul;Ah, such a beautiful name, as I expected.
speak;Saul;Igrene...|If I were to describe the pleasure of hearing such an elegant name--
speak;Igrene;No, there is no need for that.|What is it that you need?
speak;Saul;Do you know of the St. Elimine Church, Igrene?|It is very popular among the nobility, because when one prays deeply, all of one's dreams come true!
speak;Igrene;Oh... That's what you want...|I'm sorry, but I don't believe in the gods...
speak;Saul;Oh, but you must.|If you don't follow the teachings of the church, you will be cursed!
speak;Igrene;...The gods you follow would do that?
speak;Saul;Oh, no, I was just kidding around.|How about we have dinner together one evening?|Then I can teach you all about the gods' love...
speak;Saul;Uh, Igrene? Where are you going?

name: SaulIgreneSupportB
_source: speak;Saul;It is truly a miracle that we could meet once more.|Saint Elimine must have guided you towards me.
speak;Igrene;I don't think so. I'll be going now.
speak;Saul;Oh, please wait!It is a wonderful thing to believe, Igrene!
speak;Igrene;I know. I believed in gods once.|Different from yours, though.|I was quite devout.
speak;Saul;Really? Why did you stop believing?
speak;Igrene;Several years ago... I stopped praying.|It was after I lost a loved one in battle.
speak;Igrene;Those who pray to the gods expect something in return.|But when they receive nothing, they cease to believe they exist.|I think it's less trouble to never believe in the first place.
speak;Igrene;...Should a priest like you really be saying that?
speak;Saul;Yes, it's fine. I am an open-minded person.|However, Saint Elimine did say this:|"When the gods don't help us, it is because they believe in us."

name: SaulIgreneSupportA
_source: speak;Saul;Oh, Igrene! What is the matter?|Ah, you understand your feelings at last, and decided to see me...
speak;Igrene;It's about what you said before...|You said when the gods don't help us it's because they believe in us.

speak;Saul;That is what Saint Elimine said.|The gods who created this world are all-powerful.|They can change people and the world.|They can make humans docile so that we don't fight as we do now.|But what would that achieve?

speak;Saul;Humans manipulated by the gods are nothing more than mindless puppets.|The gods believe that humans can change, that we can learn from our mistakes.|The gods know that we can overcome our hardships to achieve peace.
speak;Igrene;......|I don't believe in the gods, but I respect what you say, Brother Saul.|I must be off now...
speak;Saul;Please, it is my pleasure to be of assistance.|Now, shall we discuss our dinner meeting?|...Igrene? Where are you going?

name: DorothyPercevalSupportC
_source: speak;Dorothy;I-I-I'm terribly sorry!|I was aiming for an enemy, but my arrow flew this way...|Oh, what have I done? Are you hurt?
speak;Perceval;I'm fine. It didn't even touch me.
speak;Perceval;There's no need to apologize.|Things like this often happen on the battlefield.
speak;Perceval;Even if I was hit by your arrow, I would share the blame.|After all, it's my responsibility to be aware of my surroundings.
speak;Perceval;Never let your mind wander in battle. That is a rule.|Just don't be too upset about it. All right?
speak;Dorothy;...Yes, I understand.|I'm probably just being a nuisance by apologizing over and over.|I'll try harder next time!

name: DorothyPercevalSupportB
_source: speak;Dorothy;That last shot was just luck...|I have to practice more.|Perhaps I should aim more like this...|Oh!|General Perceval!
speak;Dorothy;Y-yes, thank you!|I sometimes make mistakes like before, so I thought I should train myself so I'll be more than just a hindrance...
speak;Perceval;Good...|Dorothy, I've been thinking.|You should relax more when you shoot.
speak;Dorothy;Huh...?|You were watching how I fight?!
speak;Perceval;I always try to watch and understand how my comrades fight.|I was waiting for a chance to tell you, but I can see that you tend to panic when you fight.
speak;Dorothy;Yes, that's true...|I get scared in real battles, and I can't move the way I want to...
speak;Perceval;...There is no need for archers to come out front. Stay back and cover for us.|You must tell yourself that there is nothing to be afraid of.|We will defend the front lines.

name: DorothyPercevalSupportA
_source: speak;Perceval;You seem to have improved, Dorothy.
speak;Dorothy;General Perceval!|I'm trying to relax when I shoot, as you said.|I think...I think I'm getting better at it!
speak;Perceval;I knew you had talent.|It was just a matter of getting your confidence together, and now that you have, you'll keep improving more and more.
speak;Dorothy;I can relax when I think that the others are defending the front lines...|I'm surprised how safe I can feel on the battlefield.
speak;Perceval;Ah, but that is the same for us up front as well.|We would not be able to charge in without support from the back lines.
speak;Dorothy;...Am I useful to you too, General Perceval?
speak;Perceval;Yes, you're helping me out a great deal.|I look forward to your support in future battles.

name: DorothyYoderSupportC
_source: speak;Yoder;Ah, Dorothy.|You look unwell. What is the matter?
speak;Dorothy;Do you know why I can't use healing staves?
speak;Dorothy;I want to help injured people by using staves like you and Brother Saul.|I've been praying every day, and I think I've been faithful.
speak;Yoder;Yes, you have. Your faith is an example to us all.
speak;Dorothy;But I still can't help the injured... I want to heal them, but I can't.|Will I never have that power? Am I unworthy?
speak;Yoder;No, that's not it at all.|Do you know the story of the owl and the eagle, Dorothy?
speak;Dorothy;No, I don't.|Please tell it to me, Father Yoder.
speak;Yoder;It is a story of when Saint Elimine still walked the Earth.|One day, during Saint Elimine's journeys, an owl approached her from the forest.

speak;Yoder;The owl said to her,|"I wish to go to the land of gods. Would you show me the way?"|Saint Elimine thought for a moment, and replied, "The gods' domain lies high above the clouds.|Your wings are not strong enough to take you there."|The owl, disappointed, returned to the forest.
speak;Yoder;Yes, indeed.|We shall continue the story some other time.
speak;Yoder;Remember the teachings of Saint Elimine.|Do not try to understand things too quickly.|You must ponder on what you are told and develop your own thoughts.
speak;Dorothy;Oh... Right.|Then please continue the story another time, Father Yoder.
speak;Yoder;Of course, Dorothy. I promise you I will.

name: DorothyYoderSupportB
_source: speak;Yoder;...After parting with the owl, Saint Elimine continued on her journey.|The next day, an eagle swooped down from the mountain.

speak;Yoder;The eagle said to her,|"I wish to go to the land of gods. Would you show me the way?"|Saint Elimine thought for a moment, and replied,|"The gods' domain lies in a distant land beyond the night.|Your eyes will not be able to guide you through the dark."|The eagle, disappointed, returned to the mountain.

speak;Yoder;However, the sympathetic and kind Saint Elimine could not ignore the two birds.|She went back, and brought the owl and eagle together.|She then told them, "Journey to the land of gods together."

speak;Yoder;Yes. The two birds traveled to the gods' land together.|The eagle used his powerful wings to carry the owl, and the owl used his great eyes to guide the eagle through the night.|Together, they were able to reach the gods' domain.|That is the end of the story. Do you understand it, Dorothy?

name: DorothyYoderSupportA
_source: speak;Dorothy;I thought about it, but... I'm not very smart...|So I still don't get it...|I sort of have an idea of what it might be about, but...
speak;Yoder;Then you have an answer, Dorothy.|A story is just a story. It has no definite meaning.|Each person interprets a story and comes up with their own answers.
speak;Dorothy;Oh, good.|I think I feel better now, Father Yoder.
speak;Dorothy;But what did Saint Elimine do after that?|Are there more stories?
